solution:
Problem: What is 2 + 2?

Step 1: The bottom numbers are different. See how the slices are different sizes? | | | | | | | | | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | | 1 3 | + | 1 6 | = | ? | | | | 1/3 | | 1/6 | | pie huh? | | empty | [...] 2 6 + 1 6 = 2 + 1 6 = 3 6 In picture form it looks like this: | | | | | | | | | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | | 2 6 | + | 1 6 | = | 3 6 | | | | 2/6 | | 1/6 | | 3/6 | | empty | 2/6 1/6 3/6 empty

Step 3: Simplify the fraction: 3 6 = 1 2 In picture form the whole answer looks like this: | | | | | | | | | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | | 2 6 | + | 1 6 | = | 3 6 | = | 1 2 | | 2/6 | | 1/6 | | 3/6 | | 1/2 | 2/6 1/6 3/6 1/2 [...] Math is Fun # Adding Fractions fraction fraction A fraction like 3 4 says we have 3 out of the 4 parts the whole is divided into. ### To add fractions there are Three Simple Steps: ## Example: 1 4 + 1 4

Step 1. The bottom numbers (the denominators) are already the same. Go straight to

step 2.

Step 2. Add the top numbers and put the answer over the same denominator: 1 4 + 1 4 = 1 + 1 4 = 2 4

Step 3. Simplify the fraction: 2 4 = 1 2 In picture form it looks like this: Image 11: yes2 + 5 × 3=2 + 15=17 Image 12: not2 + 5 × 3=7 × 3=21(wrong) Otherwise just go left to right Image 13: yes30 ÷ 5 × 3=6 × 3=18 Image 14: not30 ÷ 5 × 3=30 ÷ 15=2(wrong) How Do I Remember It All ... ? PEMDAS ! --------------------------------------- PParentheses first EExponents (ie Powers and Square Roots, etc.) MDMultiplication and Division (left-to-right) ASAddition and Subtraction (left-to-right) Divide and Multiply rank equally (and go left to right). [...] Sam uses this special formula that includes the effects of gravity: height = velocity × time − (1/2) × 9.8 × time 2 Sam puts in the velocity of 20 meters per second and time of 2 seconds: height = 20 × 2 − (1/2) × 9.8 × 2 2 Now for the calculations! Start with:20 × 2 − (1/2) × 9.8 × 2 2 Parentheses first:20 × 2 − 0.5 × 9.8 × 2 2 Then Exponents (2 2=4):20 × 2 − 0.5 × 9.8 × 4 Then the Multiplies:40 − 19.6 Subtract and DONE !20.4 The ball reaches 20.4 meters after 2 seconds [...] _Warning: Calculate them in the wrong order, and you can get a wrong answer !_ So, long ago people agreed to follow rules when doing calculations, and they are: Order of Operations ------------------- Do things in Parentheses First Image 7: yes4 × (5 + 3)=4 × 8=32 Image 8: not4 × (5 + 3)=20 + 3=23(wrong) Exponents (Powers, Roots) before Multiply, Divide, Add or Subtract Image 9: yes5 × 2 2=5 × 4=20 Image 10: not5 × 2 2=10 2=100(wrong) Multiply or Divide before you Add or Subtract way to improve students' math skills and understanding, effectively boosting user confidence by providing the building blocks to tackle any type of math problem, from elementary mathematics to differential equations. Symbolab is committed to helping students learn math, providing step by step solutions to any math problem, as well as AI-driven personalized learning, assessments, insights and more. It is the most comprehensive math education tool, offering a fully automated platform based on advanced machine learning algorithms. Symbolab is a simple and intuitive [...] Please add a message. Message received. Thanks for the feedback. The instructions don't say to express the answer in mixed-number form, so I'll leave it as an improper fraction. There are no common factors between the numerator and denominator, so I can't simplify any further. So my answer is: 25/24 simplification: 25/24 simplification: 25/24 [...] You should be aware, though, that some instructors absolutely insist on you always finding and using the lcm, so you could lose points if you don't. (In my classes, I really don't care, as long as your steps are valid and your answer is correct. But that's just me.) Many times, the lcm will turn out to be the product of the denominators, anyway. Use your best judgment. ## What is "a useful form of 1"? [...] These two fractions are of the same type: they're both eighths. I've got seven of them, from which I'm subtracting five of them. This should leave me with two of them. Of course, each one-eighth is half of a one-fourth, so two of the eighths would be a single fourth. 7/8 − 5/8 = (7 − 5)/8 = 2/8 = 1/4

query: How do you solve a quadratic equation using the quadratic formula?
solution:
Problem: How do you solve a quadratic equation using the quadratic formula?

Step 2. Solve the equation. Choose 1 answer: Choose 1 answer: [...] ### Solve 4 x 2+4 x+1=0‍.

Step 1. Factor 4 x 2+4 x+1‍ as the product of two linear expressions.‍ Check I need help! This expression has the form of a perfect square: > 4 x 2+4 x+1=(2 x)2+2(2 x)(1)+(1)2‍ Therefore, it can be factored as (2 x+1)2‍, which is the same as (2 x+1)(2 x+1)‍.

Step 2. Solve the equation. Choose 1 answer: Choose 1 answer: [...] Choose all answers that apply: (Choice A) x=−2‍ - [x] A x=−2‍ (Choice B) x=1‍ - [x] B x=1‍ (Choice C) x=5‍ - [x] C x=5‍ (Choice D) x=9‍ - [x] D x=9‍ Check I need help! 3 x 2−9 x−20=x 2+5 x+16 3 x 2−9 x−20−x 2−5 x−16=0 Subtract(x 2+5 x+16).2 x 2−14 x−36=0 Combine like terms.x 2−7 x−18=0 Divide by 2.(x+2)(x−9)=0 Factor.‍ > > ↙↘x+2=0 x−9=0 x=−2 x=9‍ In conclusion, the solutions are x=−2‍ and x=9‍. 1. 7. query: An instrument store gives a 10% discount to all students off the original cost of an instrument. During a back to school sale an additional 15% is taken off the discounted price. Julie, a student at the local high school, purchases a flute for $306. How much did it originally cost?
